column4: Could anyone help me get sound working with ubuntu 9.04 Desktop?
| does alsamixer give anything?
nope.. in xp it works fine.. I tried all the options
| sudo alsaconf
okey
| what desktop you using? kde / gnome?
what directory do I run alsaconf?
| what desktop are you using
the default
| well that should have installed that for you.
| so how is this not working, does it complain the hardware notfound or just no sound coming out?
just no sound.. the h/w volume is up and so is the s/w
| so in a terminal, alsamixer
| the Master meter, do you see MM at the bottom?
| k you see the meter right, then there is a small square at the base of that meter before the numbers and then word Master
| press < and >
all three master volume controls are red
| does Card and Chip show the kind of soundcard you have?
| if you keep pressing the right arrow key, do you see PCM and Speaker?
| seems your card is recognized by ubuntu, just play around with alsamixer and test it with audacious or something to get some sound
| alsamixer ?
| just install alsaconf if its not there.. sudo apt-get install alsaconf
| try reading up here...maybe it will help
| Casper1 suggests you do this .... killall pulseaudio ; alsamixer -Dhw
